sentences.english: Too much exposure to TV programs will do great harm to the eyesight of children.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們看電視過多會年夜年夜地破壞目力。

sentences.english: Joe, with his long sight, signalled several flocks of birds of grey hovering on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 喬用他的敏銳的目力看到空中有成羣的猛禽在翱翔。

sentences.english: Secondly, walking on tiptoes will help make one's eyesight better.
sentences.chinese: 其次，將有助於踮起腳尖走路地目力更好。

sentences.english: After sleep eyes still leave screen flash, blurred vision.
sentences.chinese: 分開熒屏後仍覺長遠閃光，目力恍惚。

sentences.english: He has poor eyesight because of too much computer.
sentences.chinese: 他地目力好由於正在電腦上做啦太多。

sentences.english: He strained his eyes to catch a glimpse of the President.
sentences.chinese: 他竭盡目力想看總統一眼。

sentences.english: People wear glasses to improve their vision.
sentences.chinese: 人們戴眼鏡以改良目力。

sentences.english: You need good eyesight to be a pilot. ;
sentences.chinese: 當飛翔員需要很好的目力。

definition: eyesight/strength of vision/the ability to make discerning judgments
to investigate/to observe/to scout/to seek out and examine/to explore
pose or motion of one's body in martial arts
pitch-black/(fig.) to be completely in the dark
